segments.en: Linked Discourses 7
1. The Perfected Ones
8. With Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshipper

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa sappinā pāyaso sannihito hoti:
segments.en: Now at that time ghee and milk-rice had been set out for the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshipper, who thought,
“I will serve the sacred flame! I will perform the fire sacrifice!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.

segments.pli: Rājagahe sapadānaṃ piṇḍāya caramāno yena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: Wandering indiscriminately for alms-food in Rājagaha, he approached Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshiper’s house and stood to one side.

segments.pli: Addasā kho aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ piṇḍāya ṭhitaṃ.
segments.en: Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshipper saw him standing for alms
and addressed him in verse:
“One who’s accomplished in the three knowledges,
of good lineage and ample learning,
accomplished in knowledge and conduct
may enjoy this milk-rice.”
“Even one who mutters many invocations
is no brahmin by birth
if they’re filthy and corrupt within,
with a following gained by fraud.
But one who knows their past lives,
and sees heaven and places of loss,
and has attained the ending of rebirth,
that sage has perfect insight.
Because of these three knowledges
a brahmin is a master of the three knowledges.
Accomplished in knowledge and conduct,
they may enjoy this milk-rice.”
“Eat, Master Gotama!
you are truly a brahmin.”
“Food enchanted by a spell isn’t fit for me to eat.
That’s not the way of those who see, brahmin.
The Buddhas reject things enchanted with spells.
Since nature is real, brahmin, that’s how they live.
Serve with other food and drink
the consummate one, the great hermit,
with defilements ended and remorse stilled.
For he is the field for the seeker of merit.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshipper said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, Master Gotama! …” …

segments.pli: aññataro ca panāyasmā aggikabhāradvājo arahataṃ ahosīti.
segments.en: And Venerable Bhāradvāja the Fire-Worshipper became one of the perfected.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: A brahmin conducting a fire sacrifice invites the Buddha to accept the blessed milk-rice, claiming that the Buddha is a true brahmin.
